Battle Mode
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Card & Adventure Video Games: Monster Rancher Battlecard Episode II Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Battle Mode
By torey_luvullo on Sunday, October 1, 2000 - 05:31 am:

my daughter and i finally decided to face each other at battle mode. it turned out differently than we expected. unlike monster rancher 2, the two players do not battle each other directly [we had wondered how they would do that without the players seeing the others' cards anyway]. instead, each player chooses 2 teammates - you can choose the same people. then you play one of the other persons' team members, and the other person plays one of yours.

By Eagle Fierce on Sunday, October 1, 2000 - 12:33 pm:

Yeah, my Dad and I figured that out a short while ago. I think it makes the MRBCII vs. mode absolutely useless. If I wanted to battle a computerised team, I'd just play the game!

By Jello on Sunday, October 1, 2000 - 05:51 pm:

So you're telling me you have no control
playing the other guy or you sit and watch the
other two teammates play computerized? I
don't get this.

By torey luvullo on Monday, October 2, 2000 - 04:23 am:

me and my daughter never got the chance to have our computer decks knock heads, jello. once we chose who our teamates were going to be [i chose stolatos and sephore; she chose pabs and coccochino], it turned into a regular cup battle except i controlled my deck against one of her computer teammates[pabs], she controlled her deck against one of mine[sephore] then stolatos and coccochino had a computer v computer face off to see who won the match.

like eagle reports, it is so very ho-hum; don't expect anyone to start organizing battlecards tournaments at their local stripmall anytime soon...

By Farmer Jimbo on Monday, October 2, 2000 - 07:09 am:

Ummm... Torey, if your taking your daughter to a strip joint for battle cards, I may have to re-evaluate my opinion of you... ;)

By torey_luvullo on Monday, October 2, 2000 - 10:07 am:

this is no ordinary strip joint - it's a strip mall! they sell g-strings, pasties, fire poles and everything else you may need.
